title:
Could you explain how Eagle Point Golf Course property Tax assessment is so low? 

County Records indicate they paid 6.9 million for the land in 1998 and sold it for 8 million in 2016 from LLC to Club.



But on county tax records they list land at 4 million. As a comparison Echo Farms golf course land value is also $4 million.



The building of golf course (supposedly one of the best in country) is not considered in their taxes? 



Why are they not taxed at full value like all taxpayers in New Hanover County?
